str2: Of Hebrew origin; Judas, the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region.
Silas, a pet-form of the name Silvanus; a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul. Contraction for Silouanos; Silas, a Christian.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To prop up, uphold, support, confirm, make stronger. From epi and sterizo; to support further, i.e. Reestablish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
